title: Steton Hires Technology Industry Veteran, John Knotwell, as Chief Revenue Officer
text:
Companies mentioned in this article: Steton Technology Group, Inc. 
SALT LAKE CITY, Sept. 28, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Steton Technology Group, Inc. today announced the addition of John Knotwell as chief revenue officer. Knotwell was most recently vice president of America's sales for Workfront (formerly AtTask), and also held executive sales positions at inContact, Infinite Mind and 1-800 Contacts. As CRO, Knotwell will lead worldwide sales and alliances to drive dramatic growth for the business. 
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20150928/271334 
"Having worked with John at two different companies, I can attest to his natural talent to sell and lead successful sales organizations," said Frank Maylett, president and CEO of Steton. "He continually delivers far more than what is asked of him, and his energy is truly contagious. John will help us take the company to a new level." 
"Steton is one of the best kept secrets in technology right now, and I'm thrilled to join the team," said John Knotwell, chief revenue officer of Steton. "With its proven business performance software and impressive marquee customer base, the company is well recognized as a market leader. I'm excited to help take it to new heights." 
While leading sales at Workfront, Knotwell was instrumental in achieving an average of 50 percent year over year revenue growth for three years running, helping the company shatter growth forecasts and partner with some of the world's most recognized brands. 
Knotwell was recently named one of Utah Business Magazine's "Forty Under 40", recognizing Utah's most influential up and comers. Additionally, he serves as a member of the Utah House of Representatives. Knotwell has a Bachelor of Science in political science from the University of Utah, and is a prospective MBA graduate of the Jon M. Huntsman School of Business at Utah State University. 
For more information, visit www.steton.com . 
About Steton 
Founded in 1997, Steton was the first company to deliver business performance software that enables companies to run more efficiently, stay in compliance and strengthen brand consistency across the enterprise. Steton has 285,000 users in 120 countries and territories worldwide and is now considered the industry standard for food service, hospitality and retail. Approximately 1.7 million assessments and 200 million questions are answered annually with Steton's cloud-based software. Enterprises use this enhanced visibility in each aspect of their operation to continuously monitor processes, identify problems, implement corrective action and repeat successes. With greater, actionable business intelligence, companies can become high-performing organizations, increase same-store revenues and uncover strengths they can leverage enterprise wide. Steton is headquartered in Salt Lake City and has offices in St. George, Utah. For more information, visit www.steton.com .
